Package com.phunware.engagement.internal.database

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ModulesContract  
    SQLiteDatabaseHelper
    A helper class to manage table creation and versioning. Each module of the SDK should implement it's own helper to manage tables in it's domain. When the helper is registered with the SQLiteDatabaseManager, it's SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onCreate or SQLiteDatabaseHelper.onUpgrade method will be called, as needed. A simple implementation might look like this: public class FooDatabaseHelper implements DatabaseHelper { private static final String TABLE_NAME = "foos"; private static final int VERSION = 2; private final DatabaseManager mDbManager; public FooDatabaseHelper(DatabaseManager dbManager) { mDbManager = dbManager; mDbManager.addDatabaseHelper(this); } @Override @NonNull String getName() { return TABLE_NAME; } @Override int getVersion() { return VERSION; } @Override public void onCreate(SQLiteDatabase db) { db.exec("CREATE TABLE Foos(_ID INTEGER AUTOINCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, Content TEXT);"); } @Override public void onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db, int fromVersion, int toVersion) { int version = fromVersion; switch (version) { case 1: db.exec("ALTER TABLE Foos ADD COLUMN(IsRead INTEGER default 0);"); version++; } if (version != toVersion) { // Something went wrong with the upgrade, so drop and recreate. db.exec("DROP TABLE Foos;"); onCreate(db); } } public Foo getFooById(long id) { SQLiteDatabase db = mDbManager.getReadableDatabase(); Cursor c = db.query(...); return convertToFoo(c); } }
    SQLiteDatabaseManager
    Manages creation of the encrypted database for use by DatabaseHelpers. Supplies a single point of entry to create the database so that encryption details don't need to be widely known by consumers. Also manages
  • Class Summary
